title: Dialogue and Language in Timorese Theatre

questions.question: What are the two official languages of Timor-Leste?
choices: Tetum and Indonesian
Portuguese and English
Tetum and Portuguese
Tetum and Malay
questions.answer: Tetum and Portuguese

questions.question: What is code-switching in the context of Timorese theatre?
choices: Changing costumes between scenes
Alternating between two or more languages in a single conversation
Switching between different theatrical styles
Changing the stage layout during a performance
questions.answer: Alternating between two or more languages in a single conversation

questions.question: What is subtext in dialogue?
choices: The literal meaning of the words spoken
The underlying meaning or intention behind spoken dialogue
The translation of dialogue into another language
The stage directions written below the dialogue
questions.answer: The underlying meaning or intention behind spoken dialogue

questions.question: How can code-switching be used for character development in Timorese plays?
choices: It can reveal aspects of a character's background, education, or social status
It can show which characters are bilingual
It can indicate which characters are foreigners
It can demonstrate a character's ability to memorize lines
questions.answer: It can reveal aspects of a character's background, education, or social status

questions.question: What is one way that bilingual dialogue in Timorese theatre can explore themes of cultural identity?
choices: By using only Portuguese to show European influence
By avoiding the use of any local languages
By creating tension between traditional ways of life and colonial influences
By using only Tetum to reject foreign influences
questions.answer: By creating tension between traditional ways of life and colonial influences

questions.question: What is a challenge in adapting traditional Timorese stories for modern theatre?
choices: Finding actors who can speak ancient languages
Balancing traditional storytelling with the need for natural, believable dialogue
Removing all references to ancient customs
Translating the stories into English for international audiences
questions.answer: Balancing traditional storytelling with the need for natural, believable dialogue

questions.question: How does the use of minority languages in Timorese theatre contribute to cultural preservation?
choices: It doesn't contribute to cultural preservation
It helps preserve and promote linguistic diversity
It encourages everyone to speak only the official languages
It makes the plays more difficult to understand
questions.answer: It helps preserve and promote linguistic diversity

questions.question: What is an idiolect in the context of playwriting?
choices: A dialect spoken by a large group of people
The official language of a country
An individual's unique use of language, including vocabulary and grammar
A language that is only used in theatre
questions.answer: An individual's unique use of language, including vocabulary and grammar

questions.question: What is one way that contemporary Timorese playwrights are experimenting with language?
choices: By using only ancient languages
By avoiding all local languages
By incorporating elements of English or Indonesian
By writing plays without any dialogue
questions.answer: By incorporating elements of English or Indonesian

questions.question: What is the purpose of using subtext in Timorese theatre?
choices: To confuse the audience
To address sensitive topics or critique issues in a nuanced manner
To reduce the need for spoken dialogue
To make the play easier to translate
questions.answer: To address sensitive topics or critique issues in a nuanced manner

questions.question: In Timorese theatre, what might cause a character to switch from Tetum to Portuguese?
choices: When discussing formal or bureaucratic matters
When telling jokes
When speaking to children
When singing traditional songs
questions.answer: When discussing formal or bureaucratic matters

questions.question: What is a register in linguistic terms?
choices: A list of all words in a language
The level of formality in language use
A type of musical instrument used in theatre
The official record of a play's script
questions.answer: The level of formality in language use

questions.question: How does bilingualism in Timorese theatre reflect the country's history?
choices: It doesn't reflect the country's history
It shows the influence of Australian colonization
It reflects the complex sociolinguistic reality resulting from Portuguese colonization
It demonstrates the dominance of Indonesian culture
questions.answer: It reflects the complex sociolinguistic reality resulting from Portuguese colonization

questions.question: What is one challenge of writing bilingual dialogue for Timorese theatre?
choices: Making sure all audience members are bilingual
Avoiding the use of Tetum entirely
Balancing languages for comprehension while maintaining authenticity
Using only formal language in both Tetum and Portuguese
questions.answer: Balancing languages for comprehension while maintaining authenticity

questions.question: How can playwrights effectively convey subtext to both actors and audiences?
choices: By writing very long stage directions
By using only one language throughout the play
Through careful use of language, pauses, and contradictions between words and actions
By explaining the subtext directly to the audience
questions.answer: Through careful use of language, pauses, and contradictions between words and actions

questions.question: What is the significance of adapting traditional Timorese stories into modern dramatic forms?
choices: It helps preserve cultural heritage while making it accessible to modern audiences
It allows playwrights to avoid creating original stories
It ensures that all plays are historical dramas
It prevents the need for character development
questions.answer: It helps preserve cultural heritage while making it accessible to modern audiences

questions.question: How might a character's language choice reveal their background in a Timorese play?
choices: Using Portuguese might indicate higher education or formal training
Speaking only Tetum suggests the character is not Timorese
Using English shows the character is a tourist
Mixing languages randomly indicates confusion
questions.answer: Using Portuguese might indicate higher education or formal training

questions.question: What is one way that code-switching can create tension or humor in a play?
choices: By making the dialogue incomprehensible
By highlighting misunderstandings or cultural differences between characters
By requiring all actors to speak very quickly
By eliminating all pauses in speech
questions.answer: By highlighting misunderstandings or cultural differences between characters

questions.question: In adapting traditional stories, how might playwrights address the challenge of representing ancient characters in modern language?
choices: By using only archaic forms of Tetum and Portuguese
By creating a unique blend of poetic and colloquial speech
By having ancient characters speak only in pantomime
By using a completely invented language for all characters
questions.answer: By creating a unique blend of poetic and colloquial speech

questions.question: What role does theatre play in the linguistic landscape of Timor-Leste?
choices: It enforces the use of only one official language
It discourages the use of local languages
It serves as a space for linguistic exploration and cultural expression
It promotes the exclusive use of English in performance
questions.answer: It serves as a space for linguistic exploration and cultural expression

questions.question: How can the use of multiple languages in a play contribute to character development?
choices: It can't contribute to character development
By showing which characters are unable to learn new languages
By revealing aspects of characters' identities, relationships, and social positions
By making all characters seem equally educated
questions.answer: By revealing aspects of characters' identities, relationships, and social positions

questions.question: What is one way that Timorese playwrights might use language to address postcolonial themes?
choices: By using only pre-colonial languages
By avoiding any mention of colonial history
By exploring the tension between indigenous languages and Portuguese
By writing plays exclusively in Portuguese
questions.answer: By exploring the tension between indigenous languages and Portuguese

questions.question: How might a Timorese playwright use code-switching to create humor?
choices: By having characters speak gibberish
By using language barriers or misunderstandings between characters
By avoiding humor entirely in bilingual scenes
By using only formal language in comedic situations
questions.answer: By using language barriers or misunderstandings between characters

questions.question: What is one benefit of incorporating minority languages into Timorese theatre?
choices: It makes the plays easier to understand for all audiences
It eliminates the need for Tetum and Portuguese
It adds to the richness of the theatrical experience and promotes linguistic diversity
It ensures that only educated people can enjoy the theatre
questions.answer: It adds to the richness of the theatrical experience and promotes linguistic diversity

questions.question: How can the choice of language in a play reflect broader cultural tensions in Timorese society?
choices: It can't reflect cultural tensions
By using only foreign languages to show rejection of local culture
By avoiding any linguistic diversity
By representing the balance between traditional culture and modern influences
questions.answer: By representing the balance between traditional culture and modern influences

questions.question: What is one way that Timorese playwrights are pushing the boundaries of language use in theatre?
choices: By writing plays without any dialogue
By using only sign language
By exploring non-verbal communication and visual storytelling
By requiring all audience members to be multilingual
questions.answer: By exploring non-verbal communication and visual storytelling

questions.question: How might a playwright use language choice to indicate a shift in a character's emotional state?
choices: By having the character speak louder
By switching from one language to another in moments of high emotion
By eliminating all dialogue for that character
By using only formal language when the character is upset
questions.answer: By switching from one language to another in moments of high emotion

questions.question: What is one challenge in writing subtext for a bilingual audience?
choices: Ensuring the subtext is equally clear in both languages
Avoiding subtext entirely
Using only literal meanings in all dialogue
Writing separate plays for each language
questions.answer: Ensuring the subtext is equally clear in both languages

questions.question: How can the use of traditional Timorese languages in theatre contribute to cultural preservation?
choices: It doesn't contribute to cultural preservation
By discouraging the use of modern languages
By keeping these languages alive and relevant in contemporary contexts
By preventing any linguistic evolution
questions.answer: By keeping these languages alive and relevant in contemporary contexts
